PATIENT_ID: TEST_MSK_001
ARRIVAL_TIME: 2026-02-17 06:00:00

[TRAUMA_HP] 2026-02-17 06:10:00
Category I activation for 38-year-old male. Motorcycle collision.
Hemodynamically unstable with unstable pelvic fracture.
Pelvic ring instability confirmed on exam.
BP 78/48, HR 138, RR 28, GCS 13.
Hemodynamic instability documented. Hypotension persistent.
Right femoral head dislocation identified. AVN risk present.
Avascular necrosis risk documented for femoral head dislocation.

[IMAGING] 2026-02-17 06:30:00
CT pelvis: unstable pelvic ring disruption bilaterally.
X-ray shows fracture and dislocation of right hip.
CT confirms fracture pattern. Imaging confirming fracture.

[NURSING_NOTE] 2026-02-17 06:20:00
Pelvic binder applied. Massive transfusion initiated.
Compartment checks initiated on bilateral lower extremities.
No suspected compartment syndrome at this time.
No vascular compromise with fracture documented distally.

[OPERATIVE_NOTE] 2026-02-17 07:00:00
Emergent right hip reduction performed. Reduction attempted successfully.
Orthopedic surgery consulted and evaluated.
Orthopedic assessment completed in trauma bay.
External fixation of pelvis performed.
